title: Night shift: who turned on the moon?
author: elec-eliara3
body:
The call came in at 02:17. Complaint: “the sky is too bright, can’t sleep.” I thought — another prank. I arrive at the sector’s upper tier. And yeah.

Instead of the standard “star dome,” our projection sky shows a huge bright white thing. Looks like what the archives call a “moon.” And it shines so hard the residential blocks are lit like daytime. All lighting systems are nominal, logs show no changes. The projector just decided to show us a new picture. On its own.

A reboot fixed it. The standard stars came back. But I stood there for an hour staring at that “moon.” Beautiful, sure. And creepy. Like the ceiling grew an opinion of its own.

comments.author: common_worker_delta
comments.body: I saw it too! Woke up from the light. Thought it was already morning and I’d missed my shift! Glad you fixed it fast, otherwise the whole cycle would’ve gone off.

comments.author: techie-linus
comments.body: Not an “opinion.” Most likely a texture library glitch. The system accidentally loaded one of the archival, unused skyboxes from the First Light era. Surprised it still works. We should check archive integrity.

replies.author: student-kaelen
replies.body: Can we ask to turn it on for holidays? :) Would be pretty.

comments.author: deicide-mentor
comments.body: good that it showed just the moon. and not what’s behind it.
